title: France's political parties divided over US operation in Venezuela
subhead: Facing criticism from both opposition parties and part of his own camp, Emmanuel Macron clarified on January 5 his position on the US military operation in Venezuela. The debate has stirred up the entire French political landscape.

title: Reviving Venezuela's oil industry comes at a steep cost
subhead: The country holds the world's largest oil reserves. But after two decades of corruption, chronic underinvestment and theft, it will take years and vast amounts of money to restore production, despite Donald Trump's optimistic statements.

title: US operation in Venezuela undermined international law, UN says
subhead: 'States must not threaten or use force against the territorial integrity or political independence of any state,' Ravina Shamdasani, spokeswoman for the UN rights office, told reporters in Geneva on Tuesday.

title: With the Venezuela operation, Marco Rubio is at the heart of reshaping the 'Western Hemisphere'
subhead: The secretary of state has fully embraced the MAGA movement and President Trump's ambitions. The Spanish-speaking Rubio is the chief architect of the US intervention and the main point of contact for Venezuela's new authorities.

title: 'If, tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
subhead: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
subhead: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: In Khartoum, the faces of a martyred capital: 'War cannot kill ideas, nor love'
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (3/6). Le Monde's reporters traveled through the Sudanese capital, which for two years was the epicenter of the conflict. They met with residents, who recounted how they survived despite fear and violence.

title: With Maduro abduction, Trump flexes muscles and sends world a message
subhead: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was abducted by US special forces. He is to stand trial before a federal court in New York on charges of 'narcoterrorism conspiracy.' Donald Trump has announced that the US plans to 'run' Venezuela up until a 'proper transition' and to exploit its oil reserves.

title: Greenland is and must remain European

Yoletty Bracho, political scientist: 'We Venezuelans want to reclaim our ability to exercise our citizenship'
